file.intro: The FIX 4.0 specification delivered enhancements over FIX 3.0 in the following areas:Session layerHeader informationSupported encryptionDate fields were modifiedAllocation support was significantly improved

types.name: char
types.desc: Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M).The following fields are based on char.

types.name: data
types.desc: string field containing raw data with no format or content restrictions. Data fields are always immediately preceded by a length field. The length field should specify the number of bytes of the value of the data field (up to but not including the terminating SOH).Caution=> the value of one of these fields may contain the delimiter (SOH) character. Note that the value specified for this field should be followed by the delimiter (SOH) character as all fields are terminated with an 'SOH'.

types.name: float
types.desc: Sequence of digits with optional decimal point and sign character (ASCII characters '-', '0' - '9' and '.'); the absence of the decimal point within the string will be interpreted as the float representation of an integer value. All float fields must accommodate up to fifteen significant digits. The number of decimal places used should be a factor of business/market needs and mutual agreement between counterparties. Note that float values may contain leading zeros (e.g. '00023.23' = '23.23') and may contain or omit trailing zeros after the decimal point (e.g. '23.0' = '23.0000' = '23' = '23.').Note that fields which are derived from float may contain negative values unless explicitly specified otherwise. The following data types are based on float.

types.name: int
types.desc: Sequence of digits without commas or decimals and optional sign character (ASCII characters '-' and '0' - '9' ). The sign character utilizes one byte (i.e. positive int is '99999' while negative int is '-99999'). Note that int values may contain leading zeros (e.g. '00023' = '23').Examples =>723 in field 21 would be mapped int as |21=723|.-723 in field 12 would be mapped int as |12=-723|

types.name: Length
types.desc: int field representing the length in bytes. Value must be positive.

types.name: UTCDateOnly
types.desc: string field representing Date represented in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as 'GMT') in YYYYMMDD format. This special-purpose field is paired with UTCTimeOnly to form a proper UTCTimestamp for bandwidth-sensitive messages.Valid values:YYYY = 0000-9999, MM = 01-12, DD = 01-31.

types.name: UTCTimestamp
types.desc: string field representing Time/date combination represented in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as 'GMT') in either YYYYMMDD-HH=>MM=>SS (whole seconds) or YYYYMMDD-HH=>MM=>SS.sss (milliseconds) format, colons, dash, and period required.Valid values:YYYY = 0000-9999, MM = 01-12, DD = 01-31, HH = 00-23, MM = 00-59, SS = 00-60 (60 only if UTC leap second) (without milliseconds).YYYY = 0000-9999, MM = 01-12, DD = 01-31, HH = 00-23, MM = 00-59, SS = 00-60 (60 only if UTC leap second), sss=000-999 (indicating milliseconds).Leap Seconds=> Note that UTC includes corrections for leap seconds, which are inserted to account for slowing of the rotation of the earth. Leap second insertion is declared by the International Earth Rotation Service (IERS) and has, since 1972, only occurred on the night of Dec. 31 or Jun 30. The IERS considers March 31 and September 30 as secondary dates for leap second insertion, but has never utilized these dates. During a leap second insertion, a UTCTimestamp field may read '19981231-23:59:59', '19981231-23:59:60', '19990101-00:00:00'

fields.name: BeginString
fields.desc: Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M).The following fields are based on char.

fields.name: BodyLength
fields.desc: Sequence of digits without commas or decimals and optional sign character (ASCII characters '-' and '0' - '9' ). The sign character utilizes one byte (i.e. positive int is '99999' while negative int is '-99999'). Note that int values may contain leading zeros (e.g. '00023' = '23').Examples =>723 in field 21 would be mapped int as |21=723|.-723 in field 12 would be mapped int as |12=-723|

fields.name: MsgType
fields.desc: Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M).The following fields are based on char.

fields.name: SenderCompID
fields.desc: Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M).The following fields are based on char.

fields.name: TargetCompID
fields.desc: Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M).The following fields are based on char.

fields.name: OnBehalfOfCompID
fields.desc: Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M).The following fields are based on char.

fields.name: DeliverToCompID
fields.desc: Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M).The following fields are based on char.

fields.name: SecureDataLen
fields.desc: int field representing the length in bytes. Value must be positive.

fields.name: SecureData
fields.desc: string field containing raw data with no format or content restrictions. Data fields are always immediately preceded by a length field. The length field should specify the number of bytes of the value of the data field (up to but not including the terminating SOH).Caution=> the value of one of these fields may contain the delimiter (SOH) character. Note that the value specified for this field should be followed by the delimiter (SOH) character as all fields are terminated with an 'SOH'.

fields.name: MsgSeqNum
fields.desc: Sequence of digits without commas or decimals and optional sign character (ASCII characters '-' and '0' - '9' ). The sign character utilizes one byte (i.e. positive int is '99999' while negative int is '-99999'). Note that int values may contain leading zeros (e.g. '00023' = '23').Examples =>723 in field 21 would be mapped int as |21=723|.-723 in field 12 would be mapped int as |12=-723|

fields.name: SenderSubID
fields.desc: Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M).The following fields are based on char.

fields.name: TargetSubID
fields.desc: Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M).The following fields are based on char.

fields.name: OnBehalfOfSubID
fields.desc: Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M).The following fields are based on char.

fields.name: DeliverToSubID
fields.desc: Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M).The following fields are based on char.

fields.name: PossDupFlag
fields.desc: Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M).The following fields are based on char.

fields.name: PossResend
fields.desc: Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M).The following fields are based on char.

fields.name: SendingTime
fields.desc: string field representing Time/date combination represented in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as 'GMT') in either YYYYMMDD-HH=>MM=>SS (whole seconds) or YYYYMMDD-HH=>MM=>SS.sss (milliseconds) format, colons, dash, and period required.Valid values:YYYY = 0000-9999, MM = 01-12, DD = 01-31, HH = 00-23, MM = 00-59, SS = 00-60 (60 only if UTC leap second) (without milliseconds).YYYY = 0000-9999, MM = 01-12, DD = 01-31, HH = 00-23, MM = 00-59, SS = 00-60 (60 only if UTC leap second), sss=000-999 (indicating milliseconds).Leap Seconds=> Note that UTC includes corrections for leap seconds, which are inserted to account for slowing of the rotation of the earth. Leap second insertion is declared by the International Earth Rotation Service (IERS) and has, since 1972, only occurred on the night of Dec. 31 or Jun 30. The IERS considers March 31 and September 30 as secondary dates for leap second insertion, but has never utilized these dates. During a leap second insertion, a UTCTimestamp field may read '19981231-23:59:59', '19981231-23:59:60', '19990101-00:00:00'

fields.name: OrigSendingTime
fields.desc: string field representing Time/date combination represented in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as 'GMT') in either YYYYMMDD-HH=>MM=>SS (whole seconds) or YYYYMMDD-HH=>MM=>SS.sss (milliseconds) format, colons, dash, and period required.Valid values:YYYY = 0000-9999, MM = 01-12, DD = 01-31, HH = 00-23, MM = 00-59, SS = 00-60 (60 only if UTC leap second) (without milliseconds).YYYY = 0000-9999, MM = 01-12, DD = 01-31, HH = 00-23, MM = 00-59, SS = 00-60 (60 only if UTC leap second), sss=000-999 (indicating milliseconds).Leap Seconds=> Note that UTC includes corrections for leap seconds, which are inserted to account for slowing of the rotation of the earth. Leap second insertion is declared by the International Earth Rotation Service (IERS) and has, since 1972, only occurred on the night of Dec. 31 or Jun 30. The IERS considers March 31 and September 30 as secondary dates for leap second insertion, but has never utilized these dates. During a leap second insertion, a UTCTimestamp field may read '19981231-23:59:59', '19981231-23:59:60', '19990101-00:00:00'

fields.name: SignatureLength
fields.desc: int field representing the length in bytes. Value must be positive.

fields.name: Signature
fields.desc: string field containing raw data with no format or content restrictions. Data fields are always immediately preceded by a length field. The length field should specify the number of bytes of the value of the data field (up to but not including the terminating SOH).Caution=> the value of one of these fields may contain the delimiter (SOH) character. Note that the value specified for this field should be followed by the delimiter (SOH) character as all fields are terminated with an 'SOH'.

fields.name: CheckSum
fields.desc: Single character value, can include any alphanumeric character or punctuation except the delimiter. All char fields are case sensitive (i.e. m != M).The following fields are based on char.

messages.name: Heartbeat
messages.intro: The Heartbeat monitors the status of the communication link and identifies when the last of a string of messages was not received.

fields.name: TestReqID
fields.desc: Required when the heartbeat is the result of a Test Request message. Identifier included in Test Request message to be returned in resulting Heartbeat

messages.name: Test Request
messages.intro: The test request message forces a heartbeat from the opposing application. The test request message checks sequence numbers or verifies communication line status. The opposite application responds to the Test Request with a Heartbeat containing the TestReqID.

fields.name: TestReqID
fields.desc: Identifier included in Test Request message to be returned in resulting Heartbeat

messages.name: Resend Request
messages.intro: The resend request is sent by the receiving application to initiate the retransmission of messages. This function is utilized if a sequence number gap is detected, if the receiving application lost a message, or as a function of the initialization process.

fields.name: BeginSeqNo
fields.desc: Message sequence number of first record in range to be resent

fields.name: EndSeqNo
fields.desc: Message sequence number of last record in range to be resent. If request is for a single record BeginSeqNo = EndSeqNo. If request is for all messages subsequent to a particular message, EndSeqNo = "999999"

messages.name: Reject
messages.intro: The reject message should be issued when a message is received but cannot be properly processed due to a session-level rule violation. An example of when a reject may be appropriate would be the receipt of a message with invalid basic data which successfully passes de-encryption, CheckSum and BodyLength checks.

fields.name: RefSeqNum
fields.desc: MsgSeqNum of rejected message Reference message sequence number

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: Where possible, message to explain reason for rejection Free format text string

messages.name: Sequence Reset
messages.intro: The sequence reset message is used by the sending application to reset the incoming sequence number on the opposing side.

fields.name: GapFillFlag
fields.desc: Indicates that the Sequence Reset message is replacing administrative or application messages which will not be resent.

values.desc: Gap Fill message, MsgSeqNum field valid

fields.name: NewSeqNo
fields.desc: New sequence number. 0 - 999999

messages.name: Logout
messages.intro: The logout message initiates or confirms the termination of a FIX session. Disconnection without the exchange of logout messages should be interpreted as an abnormal condition.

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: Free format text string

messages.name: IOI
messages.intro: Indication of interest messages are used to market merchandise which the broker is buying or selling in either a proprietary or agency capacity.

fields.name: IOIid
fields.desc: Unique identifier of IOI message.

fields.name: IOITransType
fields.desc: Identifies IOI message transaction type

fields.name: IOIRefID
fields.desc: Required for Cancel and Replace IOITransType messages Reference identifier used with CANCEL and REPLACE, transaction types.

fields.name: Symbol
fields.desc: Ticker symbol. Common, "human understood" representation of the security. SecurityID (48) value can be specified if no symbol exists (e.g. non-exchange traded Collective Investment Vehicles). Use "[N/A]" for products which do not have a symbol.

fields.name: SymbolSfx
fields.desc: Additional information about the security (e.g. preferred, warrants, etc.). Absence of this field indicates common. Valid values defined in the NYSE Stock and bond Symbol Directory and in the AMEX Fitch Directory

fields.name: SecurityID
fields.desc: CUSIP or other alternate security identifier

fields.name: IDSource
fields.desc: Identifies class of alternative SecurityID. 100+ are reserved for private security identifications

fields.name: Issuer
fields.desc: Company name of security issuer (e.g. International Business Machines)

fields.name: SecurityDesc
fields.desc: Security description.

fields.name: Side
fields.desc:
Side of Indication
Valid values:
1 = Buy
2 = Sell Side of order

fields.name: IOIShares
fields.desc: Number of shares in numeric or relative size.

fields.name: Price
fields.desc: Price per share

fields.name: Currency
fields.desc: Indication without currency field is interpreted as US dollars. Identifies currency used for price, Absence of this field in a message is interpreted as US dollars. See Appendix A for information on obtaining valid values.

fields.name: ValidUntilTime
fields.desc: Indicates expiration time of indication message (always expressed in GMT)

fields.name: IOIQltyInd
fields.desc: Relative quality of indication

fields.name: IOIOthSvc
fields.desc: Applicable only if advertised on public IOI service. Indicates if, and on which other services, the indication has been advertised. Each character represents an additional service (e.g. if on Bridge and Autex, field = BA, if only on Autex, field = A)

fields.name: IOINaturalFlag
fields.desc: Indicates that IOI is the result of an existing agency order or a facilitation position resulting from an agency order, not from principal trading or order solicitation activity.

fields.name: IOIQualifier
fields.desc: Code to qualify IOI use.

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: Free format text string

messages.name: Advertisement
messages.intro: Advertisement messages are used to announce completed transactions.

fields.name: AdvId
fields.desc: Unique identifier of advertisement message

fields.name: AdvTransType
fields.desc: Identifies advertisement message transaction type

fields.name: AdvRefID
fields.desc: Required for Cancel and Replace AdvTransType messages Reference identifier used with CANCEL and REPLACE transaction types.

fields.name: Symbol
fields.desc: Ticker symbol. Common, "human understood" representation of the security. SecurityID (48) value can be specified if no symbol exists (e.g. non-exchange traded Collective Investment Vehicles). Use "[N/A]" for products which do not have a symbol.

fields.name: SymbolSfx
fields.desc: Additional information about the security (e.g. preferred, warrants, etc.). Absence of this field indicates common. Valid values defined in the NYSE Stock and bond Symbol Directory and in the AMEX Fitch Directory

fields.name: SecurityID
fields.desc: CUSIP or other alternate security identifier

fields.name: IDSource
fields.desc: Identifies class of alternative SecurityID. 100+ are reserved for private security identifications

fields.name: Issuer
fields.desc: Company name of security issuer (e.g. International Business Machines)

fields.name: SecurityDesc
fields.desc: Security description.

fields.name: AdvSide
fields.desc: Broker's side of advertised trade

fields.name: Shares
fields.desc: Number of shares

fields.name: Price
fields.desc: Price per share

fields.name: Currency
fields.desc: Indication without currency field is interpreted as US dollars. Identifies currency used for price, Absence of this field in a message is interpreted as US dollars. See Appendix A for information on obtaining valid values.

fields.name: TransactTime
fields.desc: Time of execution/order creation (expressed in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as "GMT")

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: Free format text string

messages.name: Order Cancel Reject
messages.intro: The order cancel reject message is issued by the broker upon receipt of a cancel request or cancel/replace request message which cannot be honored.

fields.name: OrderID
fields.desc: Unique identifier for Order as assigned by broker. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which accept multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the OrderID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: ClOrdID
fields.desc: Unique order id assigned by institution to the cancel request or to the replacement order. Unique identifier for Order as assigned by institution. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which electronically submit multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ClOrderID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: ClientID
fields.desc: Used for firm identification in third-party transactions. Firm identifier used in third party-transactions.

fields.name: ExecBroker
fields.desc: Used for firm identification in third-party transactions. Identifies executing / give-up broker. Standard NASD market-maker mnemonic is preferred.

fields.name: ListID
fields.desc: Required for rejects against orders which were submitted as part of a list. Customer assigned listUnique identifier for list as assigned by institution, used to associate multiple individual orders. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which generate multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ListID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: CxlRejReason
fields.desc: Code to identify reason for cancel rejection.

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: Free format text string

messages.name: Logon
messages.intro: The logon message authenticates a user establishing a connection to a remote system. The logon message must be the first message sent by the application requesting to initiate a FIX session.

fields.name: EncryptMethod
fields.desc: (Always unencrypted) Method of encryption.

values.desc: PGP/DES-MD5 (see app note on FIX home page)
PEM/DES-MD5 (see app note on FIX home page)

fields.name: HeartBtInt
fields.desc: Heartbeat interval (seconds)

fields.name: RawDataLength
fields.desc: Required for some authentication methods Number of bytes in raw data field.

fields.name: RawData
fields.desc: Required for some authentication methods Unformatted raw data, can include bitmaps, word processor documents, etc.

messages.name: News
messages.intro: The news message is intended for use as a general free format message between the broker and institution.

fields.name: OrigTime
fields.desc: Time of message origination (always expressed in GMT)

fields.name: Urgency
fields.desc: Urgency flag

fields.name: RelatdSym
fields.desc: Can be repeated multiple times if message is related to multiple symbols. Symbol of issue related to story. Can be repeated within message to identify multiple companies.

fields.name: LinesOfText
fields.desc: Identifies number of lines of text body

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: Repeating field, number of instances defined in LinesOfText Free format text string

fields.name: RawDataLength
fields.desc: Number of bytes in raw data field.

fields.name: RawData
fields.desc: Unformatted raw data, can include bitmaps, word processor documents, etc.

messages.name: Email
messages.intro: Format and purpose similar to News message, however, intended for private use between two parties.

fields.name: EmailType
fields.desc: Email message type.

fields.name: OrigTime
fields.desc: Time of message origination (always expressed in GMT)

fields.name: RelatdSym
fields.desc: Can be repeated multiple times if message is related to multiple symbols.. Symbol of issue related to story. Can be repeated within message to identify multiple companies.

fields.name: OrderID
fields.desc: Unique identifier for Order as assigned by broker. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which accept multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the OrderID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: ClOrdID
fields.desc: Unique identifier for Order as assigned by institution. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which electronically submit multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ClOrderID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: LinesOfText
fields.desc: Identifies number of lines of text body

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: Repeating field, number of instances defined in LinesOfText Free format text string

fields.name: RawDataLength
fields.desc: Number of bytes in raw data field.

fields.name: RawData
fields.desc: Unformatted raw data, can include bitmaps, word processor documents, etc.

messages.name: Order Single
messages.intro: The new order message type is used by institutions wishing to electronically submit securities and forex orders to a broker for execution.

fields.name: ClOrdID
fields.desc: Unique identifier for Order as assigned by institution. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which electronically submit multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ClOrderID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: ClientID
fields.desc: Used for firm identification in third-party transactions. Firm identifier used in third party-transactions.

fields.name: ExecBroker
fields.desc: Used for firm identification in third-party transactions. Identifies executing / give-up broker. Standard NASD market-maker mnemonic is preferred.

fields.name: Account
fields.desc: Account mnemonic as agreed between broker and institution.

fields.name: SettlmntTyp
fields.desc: Absence of this field is interpreted as Regular. Indicates order settlement period. Absence of this field is interpreted as Regular. Regular is defined as the default settlement period for the particular security on the exchange of execution.

fields.name: FutSettDate
fields.desc: Required when SettlmntTyp = 6 (Future) or SettlmntTyp = 8 (Sellers Option) Specific date of trade settlement in YYYYMMDD format. Required when SettlmntTyp = 6 (Future) or SettlmntTyp = 8 (Sellers Option). (expressed in local time at place of settlement)

fields.name: HandlInst
fields.desc: Instructions for order handling on Broker trading floor

values.desc: Automated execution order, private, no Broker intervention
Automated execution order, public, Broker intervention OK

fields.name: ExecInst
fields.desc: Can contain multiple instructions, space delimited. Instructions for order handling on exchange trading floor. If more than one instruction is applicable to an order, this field can contain multiple instructions separated by space.

values.desc: Primary peg (primary market - buy at bid/sell at offer)

fields.name: MinQty
fields.desc: Minimum quantity of an order to be executed.

fields.name: MaxFloor
fields.desc: Maximum number of shares within an order to be shown on the exchange floor at any given time.

fields.name: ExDestination
fields.desc: Execution destination as defined by institution when order is entered.

fields.name: ProcessCode
fields.desc: Used to identify soft trades at order entry. Processing code for sub-account. Absence of this field in AllocAccount / AllocShares / ProcessCode instance indicates regular trade.

fields.name: Symbol
fields.desc: Ticker symbol. Common, "human understood" representation of the security. SecurityID (48) value can be specified if no symbol exists (e.g. non-exchange traded Collective Investment Vehicles). Use "[N/A]" for products which do not have a symbol.

fields.name: SymbolSfx
fields.desc: Additional information about the security (e.g. preferred, warrants, etc.). Absence of this field indicates common. Valid values defined in the NYSE Stock and bond Symbol Directory and in the AMEX Fitch Directory

fields.name: SecurityID
fields.desc: CUSIP or other alternate security identifier

fields.name: IDSource
fields.desc: Identifies class of alternative SecurityID. 100+ are reserved for private security identifications

fields.name: Issuer
fields.desc: Company name of security issuer (e.g. International Business Machines)

fields.name: SecurityDesc
fields.desc: Security description.

fields.name: PrevClosePx
fields.desc: Useful for verifying security identification Previous closing price of security.

fields.name: Side
fields.desc: Side of order

fields.name: LocateReqd
fields.desc: Required for short sell orders Indicates whether the broker is to locate the stock in conjuction with a short sell order.

values.desc: Indicates the broker is not required to locate
Indicates the broker is responsible for locating the stock

fields.name: OrderQty
fields.desc: Number of shares ordered

fields.name: OrdType
fields.desc: Order type.

values.desc: Pegged (requires ExecInst = L, R, M, P or O)

fields.name: Price
fields.desc: Required for limit OrdTypes Price per share

fields.name: StopPx
fields.desc: Required for stop OrdTypes Price per share. 0 - 99999999.9999

fields.name: Currency
fields.desc: Message without currency field is interpreted as US dollars Identifies currency used for price, Absence of this field in a message is interpreted as US dollars. See Appendix A for information on obtaining valid values.

fields.name: IOIid
fields.desc: Required for Previously Indicated Orders (OrdType=E) Unique identifier of IOI message.

fields.name: QuoteID
fields.desc: Required for Previously Quoted Orders (OrdType=D) Unique identifier for quote

fields.name: TimeInForce
fields.desc: Absence of this field indicates Day order Specifies how long the order remains in effect. Absence of this field is interpreted as DAY.

fields.name: ExpireTime
fields.desc: Required if TimeInForce = GTD Time/Date of order expiration (always expressed in GMT)

fields.name: Commission
fields.desc: Commission

fields.name: CommType
fields.desc: Commission type

fields.name: Rule80A
fields.desc: Indicates order type upon which exchange Rule 80A is applied.

values.desc: Program Order, non-index arb, for Member firm/org
Program Order, index arb, for Member firm/org
Program Order, index arb, for individual customer
Program Order, non-index arb, for individual customer
Program Order, index arb, for other member
Program Order, non-index arb, for other member
Program Order, index arb, for other agency
All other orders as agent for other member
Program Order, non-index arb, for other agency

fields.name: ForexReq
fields.desc: Indicates that broker is requested to execute a Forex accommodation trade in conjunction with the security trade. Indicates request for forex accommodation trade to be executed along with security transaction.

values.desc: Do not execute Forex after security trade

fields.name: SettlCurrency
fields.desc: Required if ForexReq = Y. Currency code of settlement denomination.

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: Free format text string

messages.name: Order List
messages.intro: The new order list message type is used by institutions wishing to electronically submit lists of related orders to a broker for execution.

fields.name: ListID
fields.desc: Must be unique, by customer, for the day Customer assigned listUnique identifier for list as assigned by institution, used to associate multiple individual orders. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which generate multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ListID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: WaveNo
fields.desc: Identifier to aid in the management of multiple lists derived from a single, master list.

fields.name: ListSeqNo
fields.desc: Sequence of individual order within list (i.e. ListSeqNo of ListNoOrds, 2 of 25, 3 of 25, . . . )

fields.name: ListNoOrds
fields.desc: Total number of orders within list (i.e. ListSeqNo of ListNoOrds, e.g. 2 of 25, 3 of 25, . . . )

fields.name: ListExecInst
fields.desc: Include only in ListSeqNo = 1 message Free format text message containing list handling and execution instructions.

fields.name: ClOrdID
fields.desc: Unique identifier for Order as assigned by institution. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which electronically submit multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ClOrderID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: ClientID
fields.desc: Used for third-party transactions Firm identifier used in third party-transactions.

fields.name: ExecBroker
fields.desc: Used for third-party transactions Identifies executing / give-up broker. Standard NASD market-maker mnemonic is preferred.

fields.name: Account
fields.desc: Account mnemonic as agreed between broker and institution.

fields.name: SettlmntTyp
fields.desc: Absence of this field is interpreted as Regular. Indicates order settlement period. Absence of this field is interpreted as Regular. Regular is defined as the default settlement period for the particular security on the exchange of execution.

fields.name: FutSettDate
fields.desc: Required when SettlmntTyp = 6 (Future) or SettlmntTyp = 8 (Sellers Option) Specific date of trade settlement in YYYYMMDD format. Required when SettlmntTyp = 6 (Future) or SettlmntTyp = 8 (Sellers Option). (expressed in local time at place of settlement)

fields.name: HandlInst
fields.desc: Instructions for order handling on Broker trading floor

values.desc: Automated execution order, private, no Broker intervention
Automated execution order, public, Broker intervention OK

fields.name: ExecInst
fields.desc: Can contain multiple instructions, space delimited. Instructions for order handling on exchange trading floor. If more than one instruction is applicable to an order, this field can contain multiple instructions separated by space.

values.desc: Primary peg (primary market - buy at bid/sell at offer)

fields.name: ProcessCode
fields.desc: Processing code for sub-account. Absence of this field in AllocAccount / AllocShares / ProcessCode instance indicates regular trade.

fields.name: Symbol
fields.desc: Ticker symbol. Common, "human understood" representation of the security. SecurityID (48) value can be specified if no symbol exists (e.g. non-exchange traded Collective Investment Vehicles). Use "[N/A]" for products which do not have a symbol.

fields.name: SymbolSfx
fields.desc: Additional information about the security (e.g. preferred, warrants, etc.). Absence of this field indicates common. Valid values defined in the NYSE Stock and bond Symbol Directory and in the AMEX Fitch Directory

fields.name: SecurityID
fields.desc: CUSIP or other alternate security identifier

fields.name: IDSource
fields.desc: Identifies class of alternative SecurityID. 100+ are reserved for private security identifications

fields.desc: Company name of security issuer (e.g. International Business Machines)

fields.desc: Side of order

Indicates the broker is responsible for locating the stock

fields.desc: Number of shares ordered

fields.name: StopPx

fields.desc: Message without currency field is interpreted as US dollars Identifies currency used for price, Absence of this field in a message is interpreted as US dollars. See Appendix A for information on obtaining valid values.

fields.name: TimeInForce
fields.desc: Absence of this field indicates Day order Specifies how long the order remains in effect. Absence of this field is interpreted as DAY.

fields.name: ExpireTime
fields.desc: Required in TimeInForce = GTD Time/Date of order expiration (always expressed in GMT)

fields.name: Commission
fields.desc: Commission

fields.name: CommType
fields.desc: Commission type

fields.name: Rule80A
fields.desc: Indicates order type upon which exchange Rule 80A is applied.

messages.name: Order Cancel Request
messages.intro: The order cancel request message is used to request the cancellation of all or part of the remaining quantity of an existing order.

fields.name: OrigClOrdID
fields.desc: Unique ID of original order as assigned by institution Original order id as assigned by the institution, used to identify original order in cancel and cancel/replace requests.

fields.name: OrderID
fields.desc: Broker ID of original order Unique identifier for Order as assigned by broker. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which accept multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the OrderID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: ListID

messages.intro: The order cancel/replace request is used to change the parameters of an existing order.

fields.desc: Unique identifier of original order as assigned by broker Unique identifier for Order as assigned by broker. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. fields.name: ClOrdID
fields.desc: Unique identifier of replacement order as assigned by institution. Note that this identifier will be used in ClOrdID field of the Cancel Reject Message if the replacement request is rejected. Unique identifier for Order as assigned by institution. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which electronically submit multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ClOrderID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: ListID
fields.desc: Required for List Orders Customer assigned listUnique identifier for list as assigned by institution, used to associate multiple individual orders. fields.name: Account

fields.desc: Absence of this field is interpreted as Regular. Indicates order settlement period. Absence of this field is interpreted as Regular. Regular is defined as the default settlement period for the particular security on the exchange of execution.

fields.name: FutSettDate
fields.desc: Required when SettlmntTyp = 6 (Future) or SettlmntTyp = 8 (Sellers Option) Specific date of trade settlement in YYYYMMDD format. Required when SettlmntTyp = 6 (Future) or SettlmntTyp = 8 (Sellers Option). (expressed in local time at place of settlement)

fields.desc: Must match original order Instructions for order handling on Broker trading floor

fields.desc: Can contain multiple instructions, space delimited. fields.desc: Used for firm identification in third-party transactions. Identifies executing / give-up broker. Standard NASD market-maker mnemonic is preferred.

fields.desc: Ticker symbol. Common, "human understood" representation of the security. SecurityID (48) value can be specified if no symbol exists (e.g. non-exchange traded Collective Investment Vehicles). Use "[N/A]" for products which do not have a symbol.

messages.name: Allocation
messages.intro: The allocation record is used to instruct a broker on how to allocate executed shares to sub-accounts. The allocation record can also be used as a confirmation message through which third parties can communicate execution and settlement instructions between trading partners.

fields.name: AllocID
fields.desc: Unique identifier for allocation record.

fields.name: AllocTransType
fields.desc: Identifies allocation transaction type

fields.name: RefAllocID
fields.desc: Required for AllocTransType = R (Replace) or C (Cancel) Reference identifier to be used with Replace and Cancel AllocTransType records.

fields.name: NoOrders
fields.desc: Indicates number of orders to be combined for allocation. If order(s) were manually delivered set to 1 (one). Indicates number of orders to be combined for average pricing and allocation.

fields.name: ClOrdID
fields.desc: Order ID assigned by client if order(s) were electronically delivered and executed. If order(s) were manually delivered this field should contain string "MANUAL". Unique identifier for Order as assigned by institution. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which electronically submit multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ClOrderID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: OrderID
fields.desc: Unique identifier for Order as assigned by broker. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which accept multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the OrderID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: ListID
fields.desc: Required for List Orders. Customer assigned listUnique identifier for list as assigned by institution, used to associate multiple individual orders. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which generate multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ListID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: WaveNo
fields.desc: Identifier to aid in the management of multiple lists derived from a single, master list.

fields.name: NoExecs
fields.desc: Indicates number of individual execution record groups to follow. Absence of this field indicates that no individual execution records are included. No of execution record groups to follow.

fields.name: ExecID
fields.desc: Unique identifier of execution message as assigned by broker (will be 0 (zero) for ExecTransType=3 (Status)). Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which accept multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ExecID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: LastShares
fields.desc: Number of shares in individual execution. Required if NoExecs > 0 Quantity of shares bought/sold on this fill. Field not required for ExecTransType = 3 (Status)

fields.name: LastPx
fields.desc: Price of individual execution. Required if NoExecs > 0 Price of last fill. Field not required for ExecTransType = 3 (Status)

fields.name: LastMkt
fields.desc: Market of individual execution. Market of execution for last fill

fields.name: Side
fields.desc: Side of order

fields.name: Symbol
fields.desc: Ticker symbol. Common, "human understood" representation of the security. SecurityID (48) value can be specified if no symbol exists (e.g. non-exchange traded Collective Investment Vehicles). Use "[N/A]" for products which do not have a symbol.

fields.name: SymbolSfx
fields.desc: Additional information about the security (e.g. preferred, warrants, etc.). Absence of this field indicates common. Valid values defined in the NYSE Stock and bond Symbol Directory and in the AMEX Fitch Directory

fields.name: SecurityID
fields.desc: CUSIP or other alternate security identifier

fields.name: IDSource
fields.desc: Identifies class of alternative SecurityID. 100+ are reserved for private security identifications

fields.name: Issuer
fields.desc: Company name of security issuer (e.g. International Business Machines)

fields.name: SecurityDesc
fields.desc: Security description.

fields.name: Shares
fields.desc: Total number of shares allocated to all accounts Number of shares

fields.name: AvgPx
fields.desc: Calculated average price of all fills on this order.

fields.name: Currency
fields.desc: Currency of AvgPx, absence of this field indicates US dollars Identifies currency used for price, Absence of this field in a message is interpreted as US dollars. See Appendix A for information on obtaining valid values.

fields.name: AvgPrxPrecision
fields.desc: Absence of this field indicates that default precision arranged by the broker/institution is to be used Indicates number of decimal places to be used for average pricing. Absence of this field indicates that default precision arranged by the broker/institution is to be used.

fields.name: TradeDate
fields.desc: Indicates date of trade referenced in this record in YYYYMMDD format. Absence of this field indicates current day (expressed in local time at place of trade).

fields.name: TransactTime
fields.desc: Date/time when allocation is generated Time of execution/order creation (expressed in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as "GMT")

fields.name: SettlmntTyp
fields.desc: Absence of this field is interpreted as Regular Indicates order settlement period. Absence of this field is interpreted as Regular. Regular is defined as the default settlement period for the particular security on the exchange of execution.

fields.name: FutSettDate
fields.desc: Required with SettlmntTyp other than regular Specific date of trade settlement in YYYYMMDD format. Required when SettlmntTyp = 6 (Future) or SettlmntTyp = 8 (Sellers Option). (expressed in local time at place of settlement)

fields.name: NetMoney
fields.desc: Expressed in same currency as AvgPx Total amount due as the result of the transaction (e.g. for Buy order - principal + commission + fees) reported in currency of execution.

fields.name: NoMiscFees
fields.desc: Required if any miscellaneous fees are reported. Indicates number of repeating entries Number of repeating groups of miscellaneous fees

fields.name: MiscFeeAmt
fields.desc: Required if NoMiscFees > 0 Miscellaneous fee value

fields.name: MiscFeeCurr
fields.desc: Required if NoMiscFees > 0 Currency of miscellaneous fee

fields.name: MiscFeeType
fields.desc: Required if NoMiscFees > 0 Indicates type of miscellaneous fee.

fields.name: SettlCurrAmt
fields.desc: Total amount due expressed in settlement currency (includes the effect of the forex transaction)

fields.name: SettlCurrency
fields.desc: Currency code of settlement denomination.

fields.name: OpenClose
fields.desc: For options only.

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: Free format text string

fields.name: NoAllocs
fields.desc: Indicates number of allocation groups to follow. Number of AllocAccount/AllocShares/ProcessCode instances included in allocation record.

fields.name: AllocAccount
fields.desc: Sub-account mnemonic

fields.name: AllocShares
fields.desc: Number of shares to be allocated to specific sub-account

fields.name: ProcessCode
fields.desc: Processing code for sub-account. Absence of this field in AllocAccount / AllocShares / ProcessCode instance indicates regular trade.

fields.name: ExecBroker
fields.desc: Required for step-in and step-out trades Identifies executing / give-up broker. Standard NASD market-maker mnemonic is preferred.

fields.name: ClientID
fields.desc: Used for firm identification in third-party transactions. Firm identifier used in third party-transactions.

fields.name: Commission
fields.desc: Commission

fields.name: CommType
fields.desc: Commission type

fields.name: NoDlvyInst
fields.desc: Repeating group within allocation group Number of delivery instruction fields to follow

fields.name: BrokerOfCredit
fields.desc: Broker to receive trade credit

fields.name: DlvyInst
fields.desc: Required if NoDlvyInst > 0 Free format text field to indicate delivery instructions

Firms which generate multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ListID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.desc: Identifier to aid in the management of multiple lists derived from a single, master list.

messages.intro: The list execute message type is used by institutions to instruct the broker to begin execution of a previously submitted list.

Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which generate multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ListID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: WaveNo
fields.desc: Identifier to aid in the management of multiple lists derived from a single, master list.

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: Free format text string

fields.desc: Customer assigned listUnique identifier for list as assigned by institution, used to associate multiple individual orders. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. messages.name: List Status
messages.intro: The list status message is issued as the response to a List Status Request message and indicates the current state of the orders within the list as they exists at the broker's site.

fields.name: ListID
fields.desc: Customer assigned listUnique identifier for list as assigned by institution, used to associate multiple individual orders. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which generate multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ListID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: WaveNo
fields.desc: Identifier to aid in the management of multiple lists derived from a single, master list.

fields.name: NoRpts
fields.desc: Total number of messages required to status complete list. Total number of reports within series.

fields.name: RptSeq
fields.desc: Sequence number of this report message. Sequence number of message within report series.

fields.name: NoOrders
fields.desc: Number of orders statused in this message, i.e. number of repeating groups to follow. Indicates number of orders to be combined for average pricing and allocation.

fields.name: ClOrdID
fields.desc: Unique identifier for Order as assigned by institution. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which electronically submit multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ClOrderID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: CumQty
fields.desc: Total number of shares filled. (0 - 1000000000)

fields.name: CxlQty
fields.desc: Total number of shares canceled for this order.

fields.name: AvgPx
fields.desc: Calculated average price of all fills on this order.

messages.name: Allocation Instruction Ack
messages.intro: The allocation ACK record is used by the broker to acknowledge the receipt and status of an allocation record received from the institution.

fields.name: ClientID
fields.desc: Used for firm identification in third-party transactions. Firm identifier used in third party-transactions.

fields.name: ExecBroker
fields.desc: Used for firm identification in third-party transactions. Identifies executing / give-up broker. Standard NASD market-maker mnemonic is preferred.

fields.name: AllocID
fields.desc: Unique identifier for allocation record.

fields.name: TradeDate
fields.desc: Indicates date of trade referenced in this record in YYYYMMDD format. Absence of this field indicates current day (expressed in local time at place of trade).

fields.name: TransactTime
fields.desc: Date/Time allocation Ack generated Time of execution/order creation (expressed in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as "GMT")

fields.name: AllocStatus
fields.desc: Identifies status of allocation.

fields.name: AllocRejCode
fields.desc: Required for AllocStatus = 1 (rejected) Identifies reason for rejection.

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: Can include explanation for AllocRejCode = 7 (other) Free format text string

messages.name: Dont Know Trade
messages.intro: The Don’t Know Trade (DK) message is used to notify a trading partner that an electronically received execution has been rejected. This message can be thought of as an execution reject message.

fields.name: OrderID
fields.desc: Broker Order Id as identified on problem execution Unique identifier for Order as assigned by broker. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which accept multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the OrderID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: ExecID
fields.desc: Execution Id of problem execution Unique identifier of execution message as assigned by broker (will be 0 (zero) for ExecTransType=3 (Status)). Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which accept multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ExecID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: DKReason
fields.desc: Reason for execution rejection.

fields.name: Symbol
fields.desc: Ticker symbol. Common, "human understood" representation of the security. SecurityID (48) value can be specified if no symbol exists (e.g. non-exchange traded Collective Investment Vehicles). Use "[N/A]" for products which do not have a symbol.

fields.desc: Side of order

fields.desc: Number of shares ordered

fields.desc: Quantity of shares bought/sold on this fill. Field not required for ExecTransType = 3 (Status)

fields.name: LastPx
fields.desc: Price of last fill. Field not required for ExecTransType = 3 (Status)

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: Free format text string

fields.name: SecurityDesc
fields.desc: Security description.

fields.name: BidPx
fields.desc: Bid price/rate

fields.name: OfferPx
fields.desc: Offer price/rate

fields.name: BidSize
fields.desc: Quantity of bid

fields.name: OfferSize
fields.desc: Quantity of offer

fields.name: ValidUntilTime
fields.desc: Indicates expiration time of indication message (always expressed in GMT)

messages.name: Execution Report
messages.intro: The execution report message is used to:Confirm the receipt of an orderConfirm changes to an existing order (i.e. accept cancel and replace requests)Relay order status informationRelay fill information as orders are workedReject ordersReport miscellaneous fees calculations associated with a trade

fields.name: OrderID
fields.desc: Unique identifier for Order as assigned by broker. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which accept multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the OrderID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: ClOrdID
fields.desc: Required for executions against electronically submitted orders which were assigned an ID by the institution. Not required for orders manually entered by the broker. Unique identifier for Order as assigned by institution. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which electronically submit multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ClOrderID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: ClientID
fields.desc: Used for firm identification in third-party transactions. Firm identifier used in third party-transactions.

fields.name: ExecBroker
fields.desc: Used for firm identification in third-party transactions. Identifies executing / give-up broker. Standard NASD market-maker mnemonic is preferred.

fields.name: ListID
fields.desc: Required for executions against orders which were submitted as part of a list. Customer assigned listUnique identifier for list as assigned by institution, used to associate multiple individual orders. Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which generate multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ListID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: ExecID
fields.desc: Unique identifier of execution message as assigned by broker (will be 0 (zero) for ExecTransType=3 (Status)). Uniqueness must be guaranteed within a single trading day. Firms which accept multi-day orders should consider embedding a date within the ExecID field to assure uniqueness across days.

fields.name: ExecTransType
fields.desc: Identifies transaction type

fields.name: ExecRefID
fields.desc: Required for Cancel and Correct ExecTransType messages Reference identifier used with Cancel and Correct transaction types.

fields.name: OrdStatus
fields.desc: Identifies current status of order.

fields.name: OrdRejReason
fields.desc: For optional use with OrdStatus = 8 (Rejected) Code to identify reason for order rejection.

fields.name: Account
fields.desc: Required for executions against electronically submitted orders which were assigned an account by the institution Account mnemonic as agreed between broker and institution.

fields.name: SettlmntTyp
fields.desc: Absence of this field is interpreted as Regular. Indicates order settlement period. Absence of this field is interpreted as Regular. Regular is defined as the default settlement period for the particular security on the exchange of execution.

fields.name: FutSettDate
fields.desc: Required when SettlmntTyp = 6 (Future) or SettlmntTyp = 8 (Sellers Option) Specific date of trade settlement in YYYYMMDD format. Required when SettlmntTyp = 6 (Future) or SettlmntTyp = 8 (Sellers Option). (expressed in local time at place of settlement)

fields.name: Symbol
fields.desc: Ticker symbol. Common, "human understood" representation of the security. SecurityID (48) value can be specified if no symbol exists (e.g. non-exchange traded Collective Investment Vehicles). Use "[N/A]" for products which do not have a symbol.

fields.name: SymbolSfx
fields.desc: Additional information about the security (e.g. preferred, warrants, etc.). Absence of this field indicates common. Valid values defined in the NYSE Stock and bond Symbol Directory and in the AMEX Fitch Directory

fields.name: SecurityID
fields.desc: CUSIP or other alternate security identifier

fields.name: IDSource
fields.desc: Identifies class of alternative SecurityID. 100+ are reserved for private security identifications

fields.name: Issuer
fields.desc: Company name of security issuer (e.g. International Business Machines)

fields.name: SecurityDesc
fields.desc: Security description.

fields.name: Side
fields.desc: Side of order

fields.name: OrderQty
fields.desc: Number of shares ordered

fields.name: OrdType
fields.desc: Order type.

values.desc: Pegged (requires ExecInst = L, R, M, P or O)

fields.name: Price
fields.desc: Price per share

fields.name: StopPx
fields.desc: Required for OrdType = 4 (Stop Limit). Price per share. 0 - 99999999.9999

fields.name: Currency
fields.desc: Message without currency field is interpreted as US dollars Identifies currency used for price, Absence of this field in a message is interpreted as US dollars. See Appendix A for information on obtaining valid values.

fields.name: TimeInForce
fields.desc: Absence of this field indicates Day order Specifies how long the order remains in effect. Absence of this field is interpreted as DAY.

fields.name: ExpireTime
fields.desc: Required if TimeInForce = GTD Time/Date of order expiration (always expressed in GMT)

fields.name: ExecInst
fields.desc: Can contain multiple instructions, space delimited. Instructions for order handling on exchange trading floor. If more than one instruction is applicable to an order, this field can contain multiple instructions separated by space.

values.desc: Primary peg (primary market - buy at bid/sell at offer)

fields.name: Rule80A
fields.desc: Indicates order type upon which exchange Rule 80A is applied.

values.desc: Program Order, non-index arb, for Member firm/org
Program Order, index arb, for Member firm/org
Program Order, index arb, for individual customer
Program Order, non-index arb, for individual customer
Program Order, index arb, for other member
Program Order, non-index arb, for other member
Program Order, index arb, for other agency
All other orders as agent for other member
Program Order, non-index arb, for other agency

fields.name: LastShares
fields.desc: Not required ExecTransType = 3 (Status) Quantity of shares bought/sold on this fill. Field not required for ExecTransType = 3 (Status)

fields.name: LastPx
fields.desc: Not required for ExecTransType = 3 (Status) Price of last fill. Field not required for ExecTransType = 3 (Status)

fields.name: LastMkt
fields.desc: Market of execution for last fill

fields.name: LastCapacity
fields.desc: Broker capacity in order execution

fields.name: CumQty
fields.desc: Total number of shares filled. (0 - 1000000000)

fields.name: AvgPx
fields.desc: Calculated average price of all fills on this order.

fields.name: TradeDate
fields.desc: Used when reporting other than current day trades. Indicates date of trade referenced in this record in YYYYMMDD format. Absence of this field indicates current day (expressed in local time at place of trade).

fields.name: TransactTime
fields.desc: Time of execution/order creation (expressed in UTC (Universal Time Coordinated, also known as "GMT")

fields.name: ReportToExch
fields.desc: Identifies party of trade responsible for exchange reporting.

values.desc: Indicates that party sending message will report trade
Indicates that party receiving message must report trade

fields.name: Commission
fields.desc: Commission

fields.name: CommType
fields.desc: Commission type

fields.name: NoMiscFees
fields.desc: Required if any miscellaneous fees are reported. Indicates number of repeating entries. Number of repeating groups of miscellaneous fees

fields.name: MiscFeeAmt
fields.desc: Required if NoMiscFees > 0 Miscellaneous fee value

fields.name: MiscFeeCurr
fields.desc: Required if NoMiscFees > 0 Currency of miscellaneous fee

fields.name: MiscFeeType
fields.desc: Required if NoMiscFees > 0 Indicates type of miscellaneous fee.

fields.name: NetMoney
fields.desc: Required if miscellaneous fees are reported, in currency of execution Total amount due as the result of the transaction (e.g. for Buy order - principal + commission + fees) reported in currency of execution.

fields.name: SettlCurrAmt
fields.desc: Used to report results of forex accommodation trade Total amount due expressed in settlement currency (includes the effect of the forex transaction)

fields.name: SettlCurrency
fields.desc: Used to report results of forex accommodation trade Currency code of settlement denomination.

fields.name: Text
fields.desc: Free format text string

messages.name: Standard Header
messages.intro: The standard FIX message header

fields.name: BeginString
fields.desc: Always unencrypted, must be first field in message. Identifies beginning of new message and protocol version.

fields.name: BodyLength
fields.desc: (Always unencrypted, must be second field in message) Message length, in bytes, forward to the CheckSum field. ALWAYS SECOND FIELD IN MESSAGE. (Always unencrypted)

fields.name: MsgType
fields.desc: (Always unencrypted, must be third field in message) Defines message type. ALWAYS THIRD FIELD IN MESSAGE. (Always unencrypted). Note: A "U" as the first character in the MsgType field indicates that the message format is privately defined between the sender and receiver.

fields.name: SenderCompID
fields.desc: (Always unencrypted) Assigned value used to identify firm sending message.

fields.name: TargetCompID
fields.desc: (Always unencrypted) Assigned value used to identify receiving firm.

fields.name: OnBehalfOfCompID
fields.desc: Trading partner company ID used when sending messages via a third party (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Assigned value used to identify firm originating message if the message was delivered by a third party i.e. the third party firm identifier would be delivered in the SenderCompID field and the firm originating the message in this field.

fields.name: DeliverToCompID
fields.desc: Trading partner company ID used when sending messages via a third party (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Assigned value used to identify the firm targeted to receive the message if the message is delivered by a third party i.e. the third party firm identifier would be delivered in the TargetCompID field and the ultimate receiver firm ID in this field.

fields.name: SecureDataLen
fields.desc: Required to identify length of encrypted section of message. (Always unencrypted) Length of encrypted message

fields.name: SecureData
fields.desc: Required when message body is encrypted. Always immediately follows SecureDataLen field. Actual encrypted data stream

fields.name: MsgSeqNum
fields.desc: (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Integer message sequence number.

fields.name: SenderSubID
fields.desc: (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Assigned value used to identify specific message originator (desk, trader, etc.)

fields.name: TargetSubID
fields.desc: "ADMIN" reserved for administrative messages not intended for a specific user. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Assigned value used to identify specific individual or unit intended to receive message. "ADMIN" reserved for administrative messages not intended for a specific user.

fields.name: OnBehalfOfSubID
fields.desc: Trading partner SubID used when delivering messages via a third party. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Assigned value used to identify specific message originator (desk, trader, etc.) if the message was delivered by a third party

fields.name: DeliverToSubID
fields.desc: Trading partner SubID used when delivering messages via a third party. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Assigned value used to identify specific message recipient (desk, trader, etc.) if the message is delivered by a third party

fields.name: PossDupFlag
fields.desc: Always required for retransmissions, whether prompted by the sending system or as the result of a resend request. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Indicates possible retransmission of message with this sequence number

fields.name: PossResend
fields.desc: Required when message may be duplicate of another message sent under a different sequence number. (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Indicates that message may contain information that has been sent under another sequence number.

fields.name: SendingTime
fields.desc: (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Time of message transmission (always expressed in GMT)

fields.name: OrigSendingTime
fields.desc: Required for message resends. If data is not available set to same value as SendingTime (Can be embedded within encrypted data section.) Original time of message transmission (always expressed in GMT) when transmitting orders as the result of a resend request.

messages.name: Standard Trailer
messages.intro: The standard FIX message trailer

fields.name: SignatureLength
fields.desc: Required when trailer contains signature. Note: Not to be included within SecureData field Number of bytes in signature field.

fields.name: Signature
fields.desc: Note: Not to be included within SecureData field Electronic signature

fields.name: CheckSum
fields.desc: (Always unencrypted, always last field in message) Three byte, simple checksum (see Appendix B for description). ALWAYS LAST FIELD IN RECORD; i.e. serves, with the trailing , as the end-of-record delimiter. Always defined as three characters. (Always unencrypted)
